title: Bird Study
summary: Build identification skills, keep a field notebook, explore habitats and conservation, and share your observations.

resources.title: Cornell Lab – All About Birds
resources.description: Field guides, ID tips, and seasonal birding advice.

resources.title: Audubon Bird Guide App
resources.description: Free mobile guide with photos, sounds, and habitat info.

resources.title: Merlin Bird ID
resources.description: Instant identification help using photos or songs.

modules.title: Identification Basics
modules.instructions: Describe how to ID birds using size/shape, field marks, behavior, habitat, and voice. List three local species with one distinguishing trait each.

modules.title: Field Notebook
modules.instructions: Keep a notebook with at least 6 observations on different days. For each: date, time, location, weather, species (or 'unknown'), behavior, and sketch/photo if possible.

modules.title: Habitats & Adaptations
modules.prompt: Pick two species and explain how their beaks, feet, or behavior fit their habitat.

modules.title: Conservation & Ethics
modules.instructions: Summarize two threats to birds in your area (e.g., habitat loss, window strikes, invasive species) and one action you can take at home or school.

modules.title: Share Your Observations
modules.instructions: Create a 3–5 minute presentation or one-page report highlighting three birds you observed. Include maps or checklists if you used them.
